DOC.brief_title: Small Airways Disease Asymptomatic Symptomatic Subjects With Airway Hyperresponsiveness ( AHR )
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion asymptomatic subject airway hyperresponsiveness ( AHR ) : Age 18 65 year . Forced expiratory volume one second ( FEV1 ) > 80 % predict post bronchodilator . Provocative concentration cause 205 fall FEV1 ( PC20 ) methacholine < 8 mg/ml . No history asthma previous use asthma medication . Inclusion criterion asymptomatic subject without AHR : Age 18 65 year . FEV1 > 80 % predict post bronchodilator . PC20 methacholine > 8 mg/ml . No history asthma previous use asthma medication . Inclusion criteria patient asthma : Age 18 65 year . FEV1 > 80 % predict . PC20 methacholine â‰¤8 mg/ml . Doctor 's diagnosis asthma . No history Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) . Use inhale oral steroid , antihistamine , nedocromil , theophylline , leukotrien antagonist longacting betaagonists least three week start study . Any disease may affect outcome study judge Investigator . FEV1 < 1.2 liter .
